name: Injustice: Gods Among Us Ultimate Edition
description: Injustice: Gods Among Us Ultimate Edition enhances the bold new franchise to the fighting game genre from NetherRealm Studios. Featuring six new playable characters, over 30 new skins, and 60 new S.T.A.R. Labs missions, this edition packs a punch.
minimum_requirements: OS: 32-bit Windows 7 / Windows 8 / Vista Processor: Intel® Core™ 2 Duo 2.4 GHz or AMD Athlon X2 2.8 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce™ 8800 GTS or AMD® Radeon™ HD 3850 DirectX: Version 10 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 21 GB available space Additional Notes: Windows XP and DirectX® 9.0b and below not supported
recommended_requirements: OS: 64-bit Windows 7 / Windows 8 / Vista Processor: Intel Core i5-750, 2.67 GHz or AMD Phenom II X4 965, 3.4 GHz or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce™ GTX 560 or AMD® Radeon™ HD 6950 DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 22 GB available space Additional Notes: Windows XP and DirectX® 9.0b and below not supported

reviews.review_text: The game is geat, this port isn't.  Stop hiring High Voltage for these travesties, they're behind so many bad ports and HD editions that it's not even funny. From Zone of the Enders HD to the horrors of MK9 and MKX, they've botched every port they touch. Low framerate, bad performance on machines that should handle them perfectly, and arbitrary glitches.  Get out.

Online play don't even work on Steam. High Voltage did a horrible job for the port. That critical problem have been there since day 1 of the release and absolutely nothing have been done yet even if there are legions of players on the discussion forums that complain about not having access to the main feature of the game.   This game do not deserve a single of your penny.

If you like singleplayer fighting games, go get it! It sure is one of the best fighters I played in years. Same applies if you just want to do local matches. If you want to play online on the other hand, avoid it like the plague, go get the console version instead. The online barely works, if it works it is great but the chance you'll get a decent match is like winning the lottery. Around 90% of the matches end up in a terrible lagfest (also, if your opponent has a crappy PC the game goes slowmo) or you can't even connect or the game abruptly ends telling you, 'the game session is no longer available'. Get the 360 version instead, I played it and it works flawlessly online there.

A very well done fighting game! Has all the things you expect in a 2D fighter with its own twist to things. Great characters, story, graphics, and runs well. Many people have had internet connection problems with the game, but these can be kinked out by the developer.
Joker shot me with a rocket launcher and set me on fire. Ten minutes later, Bane broke my back. And Lex Luthor shot me with an orbital laser strike.  10/10 best way to die
Netherrealms Studios did Justice to us by releasing this Injustice  :D
If you are in for multiplayer, do not buy this game. It does not work. Great game storywise

great fighting game. the story was very good and well put together. I really enjoyed it. make sure to learn about how to tweak the game to work well on pc (i.e. the solo practice trick to fix the framerate).

****WARNING HUGE LAG AND SERVER ISSUES****  If like me, you are about to buy this game in order to go online with a friend and pummel each other with our favourite DC superheros; be warned. I have never encountered so much lag and poor online support for a game in my life, servers are clearly not managed well causing a very frustrating online experience and thats even if you get to be in a game....  BUT, The actual gameplay of this game is pretty damn good, just what you would expect from the creators of MK leading to some satisfying violent fighter game. The story also was pretty good and if any DC comic appreciators like me play it then they will be walking away satisfyed with the story.  All in all, I would reccommend buying this game on a console in order to get the full package as this PC port has obviosuly not worked out. 6/10

On Consoles this game is a guranteed 10/10, but not on PC, this game is in constant extreme lag, multiplayer is almost impossible to connect too, and if you some how manage to get into a match it automatically disconnects for no reason, mobile unlocks going both ways won't connect even when your appearently logged into both, when ever I try exit the game it freezes and no matter what you do you won't be able to leave until you restart the computer, which doesn't save your progess if it doesn't auto save which happens quite a lot, even though I love this game I can't recommend it for PC because it's just not worth it even when its on sale for $4.99 and especially when it's $19.99 if you have a console I recommend you just get it on that

I good game, its just this PC port is horrible. Constant framerate issues making the game unplayable, game breaking bugs and unresponisve controls. Overall don't get the game on PC get it on a console because this port is on the bad end of gaming

It's good. It's really good. Injustice is without doubt one of the best fighting games I have ever played, next to Mortal Kombat and Soul Calibour. What Injustice does well... is mostly everything. It has very good graphics, tight controls, many playable characters from whom every single is different, several arenas, most of which have two stages each, and I could not even tell if it was a console port. Most heroes have several different outfits, which is good in most cases, but looking at Teen Titans costumes for Raven and Cyborg I didn't find them similiar in any degree to their cartoon counterparts. And I kind of missed a Starfire character. On the other hand there is a version of Batman that wears a Russian ushanka, and there is Superman skin with a hammer'n'sickle emblem on his chest, and that is just plain awesome. Every character also has their own exclusive super move, or whatever it is called, which is a counterpart of the X-ray moves from Mortal Kombat. So in addition to pummeling the crap out of his foes, Batman can run someone over with the Batmobile, and Joker can blast someone with a bazooka, which I have no idea where he keeps.There are several game modes for singleplayer, which will keep you playing for a long time. There is story mode, classic battle and lots of its variations, and S.T.A.R. labs, which consists of lots and lots of minigames and small quests. Overall, this game has some minor flaws, like the completly redundant clash mechanic, or rare issues with attacks ghost range, but it is still solid and fun fighting game. But there is one thing that keeps it from ranking higher, at least in PC version, and it is the multiplayer mode. It sucks. It sucks so bad...I didn't even have a chance to play it. Seriously. You can wait for an hour and not find a single (!) match. And it is not even the game's fault. It is just that nobody plays it, which makes me sad. So, for the love of all gods, buy this game and play it, because for now, from my experience, about 20 people own it.   Injustice: Gods Among Us gets my eight points out of ten.

Netcode and hardware requirements are pretty terrible. There are consistent updates to attempt to fix these issues, but from what I've experienced so far, they have quite a bit to go, so far it is largely unplayable, and online the netcode sacrifices input accuracy for a smoothness in gameplay, which if you play fighting games to any capacity, you'll find failing combos when should have totally linked them. Stay away for now, go buy Skullgirls instead.
I love heroes. I love fighting game. That's why I love this game.
Great fighting game like mortal kombat, with plenty of charaters to choose from, love the cut scenes and special moves, if you love superheroes i would recommend this game...

Got this on sale for five bucks, hell of a deal. I'm not a huge fan of the Mortal Kombat-style fighting game--in fact it's probably my least favorite of all the fighting games--but as a fan of comics and fighting games in general, I couldn't resist with the price tag.   PROS:  - Great selection of fighters.  - Fighters generally seem balanced and fairly easy to learn within a couple fights.  - Solid gameplay--hits land where they should.  - Cool story mode (bro).  - Great voice acting, and there are specific voiceovers for clashes between two characters (even themselves), always a nice touch.  - Special moves/ultimates are a blast to perform, albeit easy.  CONS:  - Maybe it's just me, but I don't like this 'wager' system. When you or your opponent initiate a clash, you each 'wager' a certain amount of your energy bar then rush at each other and whoever 'wins' the wager does damage to the other, knocks them across the stage, and regains a portion of their health, I think it's up to 30%. So for example, let's say you just burned your ultimate on your opponent, which requires 100% of your bar and drains it to 0%. Your opponent still has 100%. Now they can initiate a clash and basically get all that health back for free just by punching you across the screen, and you have no way to stop it because, since your energy is 0%, you can't wager. Not a fan of it, but if this is what they call 'balance,' okay, whatever.  - Controller is too sensitive. I find myself jumping when I don't want to be more than half the time, and some combos that require directional input are way harder to pull off than they seem, partly due to the controller sensitivity and partly due to how rapidly you have to press the buttons in order to combo.  - Speaking of which, that. Maybe this is specific to this type of fighting game (and partly why I don't like it), but combos don't feel like they're being performed in 'real time,' rather that you're sort of quickly ordering a combo and then it occurs. But if you press the buttons at the same time the attacks actually happen, it doesn't combo. Doesn't sit right with me.  And this isn't a pro or a con necessarily, but the story mode is a bit easy, at least to me. Soon as you learn a combo and a projectile for a character it's pretty trivial. Maybe I haven't gotten far enough for it to really get difficult.   Overall, worth checking out, definitely worth a buy on sale, or if you're a fan of the Mortal Kombat-esque fighting style.

Overall score: 9/10 Pros: Entertaining story, excellent cast of fighters, superb voice acting, well animated, easy to control, and well balanced.  Cons: Since every hero only has one, super moves become repetitive after awhile. More variety of moves would grant this game a perfect 10.
great fun for playing with friends online in a skype call only downside is that there arent a lot of people online 8.5/10 NOTE: way easier with a controller then keyboard Thanks for reading

I really like fighting games, I like fighting games so much that I built an arcade cabinet to play fighting games with real arcade joysticks and buttons. That being said, I think this is a good fighting game. It isn't the most balanced or have the deepest fighting system, but it is a lot of fun. Being able to throwdown as Batman or even Aquaman makes it awesome. I was really excited when this came to the PC and aside from some keyboard configuration issues (fixed with VJoy) and performance issues I haven't been disappointed.

Great fighting game, made by the same guys who made Mortal Kombat Komplete. It's a fighting game, but with superheroes. Has a solid story mode, and multiplayer is pretty sweet. The moves are a bit deceptive because it feels a little Street Fightery (hold back to block), but a bit Mortal Kombaty (both triggers to use your super), yet the attacks feel a little unique to this game.   There isn't really any 'rounds', but you do have a double-life bar which breaks into two 'sections' and the loser still has to take down the winner's remaining life from his first 'section'. This works pretty well, except the timer for multiplayer games is on 99 seconds to kill off both 'sections' from your opponent - which is usually only enough for a single round, and doesn't reset in this game. This is the game's low point, so you have to win fairly quickly.  In multiplayer, you can press start just before the round begins and during supers (or anytime, at your own risk - the game continues) to get a 'quick reference' on your special moves, which is a very, very welcome addition for choosing characters you've never played before. Getting a quick glance at 'down-forward-X' 'back-forward A' is a huge help, even if you don't know what that move does.  There's a good tutorial that'll get you rolling pretty quickly, and the newer players that pick up this game seem to have a knack for killing the experienced players in the first game.

I don't know of a better fight game then Injustice. The greatness of Mortal Kombat incorportated in the DC Universe. The ability to play as such a wide variety of your favorite villains and heroes makes this game so great. As far as the story goes I would definately say that it is quite entertaining. With impressive cutscenes inbetween fights to help mix things up a bit, the story mode is something that could be played a couple times and still be able to enjoy it. Keep in mind of course that this is still a fight game, and like all fight games, you will lose interest after a while. But I can honestly say though I'm not as devoted to the game as I used to be. I still play it probably once a week just because it really is that fun. The multiplayer in it is also a great feature in which you can enjoy playing on the same computer with a friend (a controller or extra keyboard is recommended) or online. This game will always be a challenge and something in which you can definately get your money's woth out of.

It's the best MK game so far. New characters to learn move sets and hit detection for, and the story mode doesn't feel like a tacked-on 'play this character that noone in PvP likes' gimmick. Good story, if not a little stale as DC loves to trot out multiple universes anytime they want to do something edgy with a character or two. The dlc characters are fun (you WILL kneel before Zod) and getting this game on a crazy sale these days is pretty easy. And pretty much a no-brainer. If you like to fight, get the game. And a controller.

This is a nice take on an arcade classic figthing games. I like the gameplay break down and the pace of the game, the over all quality of the textures and graphics are nice. Playing combos trying to feel like Joystick Jesus. I would never buy this game full price. I picked it up when it was on Steam Summer Sale a year back. People still play but the community is all hardcore players. You would be better off trying to play something else if you didn't have a nack for arcade figters.
Not bad overall.. Slowdown can be a bit annoying in the single player, but I've enjoyed this game if you want a good solid beat em up.

I don't play fighting games very much. I liked Mortal Kombat and Street Fighter from back in the day, but I was that jerk who always picked Blanca and then spammed his forward roll. I found this one pretty accessible, and a lot of fun. The characters have some great special moves (Batman can summon his Batmobile to run over his opponent, for example) and the arenas are full of interactable objects. The single-player eases you into it and tells a little story as you move along. It's good fun, it's forgiving of newbies, and it gets a thumbs-up from me.

This was a pretty satisfying comic based fighting game. The graphics were slick, the levels well detailed and even interactive, and the fighter roster was brimming with most of my favorites. Add in a pretty competent fighting system and tons of unlockables for the characters and you got one of the better DC based games, forget the fact that it's a fighting game. The story came together incredibly well and felt like a complete 10-20 issue story arc. The best part was that it was structured in a way that you swapped out fighters to progress and this swapping played into the cohesiveness of the story, which is something seldom done well in a fighter. My only quibble is the terrific buildup of tension and amazing moments punctuated by a rather anti-climatic or boring conclusion. In this case the journey is far greater than the destination.

It's mortal kombat, but not. More like a mortal combat that if flashy and imbalanced. Some characters are downright unplayable against a worthy opponent and some characters are played religiously by spam-happy opponents. Not perfect, but for some casual play this game is superb.
Recommended to play with controller, playing on PC hurts hand.

If you like fighting games and comic book superheroes, this is a great choice. I admit, I've never been a fan of Mortal Kombat and this game's lineage sort of turned me off of it. Boy, do I wish I got into it sooner. It's very different from what I expected (there is almost no gore and the story makes sense) and I plan on picking it up for Wii U really soon. I've played through the story mode once but would like to again as well as get some buddies together and smash each other. This is the sort of game that doesn't require someone to memorize a ton of combos and special moves. They exist but the game is a bit easier to handle right off the bat. The real shining point is the story mode which is engaging if you like DC and is very unique for a fighting game. I love how cinematics blend seamlessly into fights. Even mini games are occassionally stuck in but unlike bashing sedans on a pier, these games make sense in the story. Try it.
Pretty fun game so far. Also seems to be a glitch that if you buy a single costume from the archives, you get the achievement for buying all the costumes so that gets an 11/10 from me.
DC heros in a destructive awesome combat fuq yeth  if you're gonna get this you should get a PC controller. its way better like that

Yes I know i'm reviewing yet Another Beat em up  Made by the same guys that brought you Mortal Kombat Komplete Edition, Injustice is set in the DC Universe, where strange things are a foot, not really gonna say much about the story as I think it's one of the better elements and you should see it for yourself instead of having someone read it too you  or Youtube it  ok, so why buy this game?  firstly it's one of the most complete Beat em up's available and builds on the combo styling of MK9, each character has there own move set and super move basd on the hero in question  such as Green Arrows super button , fire's his bow and is used for equipping special arrows such as flaming, freezing and electric  while batmans summons robo bats to use as a shield or projectiles, or wonder womans swaps between lasso or sword and shield  So each character's moves and specials fit with what you'de expect from them.  here's a big negative though, the game requires a powerful pc to run well, and the graphics can't really be toned down to compansate  but for those that can run this, it's a very good game, while i feel it could have had more modes, the offering is nice  so pro's and con's time  pro's   @ Large Roster, sometimes you won't have heard of certain characters though 'Cough' Killer Frost 'Cough' @ Training mode is extensive @ Connecting to the internet is easier than MK9 @ has new challenges weekly  con's  @ Powerful Pc Required @ Story Mode Learning Curve @ X Box icons in a PC game is lazy @ Some of the female characters look blokey, Zatanna, Wonder Woman, and other  Graphics 10 / 10 on a powerful pc this looks gorgeous Gameplay 8 / 10 could have benefited from more modes Sound 7 / 10 good, but subdued Overall 8 / 10 A good beat em up to get you started

Injustice Gods Among Us is a fighting game developed by the same studio that made Mortal Kombat 9 and I have to say, for $20 this game is so worth it especially if it's on sale. So where should I start... perhaps the amount of content you get in this game? If you are a type of person who likes to collect all of the DLC then look no further, this game has it all with over 30 DLC skins(iOS skins not included), 6 DLC characters and all the DLC S.T.A.R labs missions including the Red Son ones. Now the next thing I will go over is the amount of hours you will be spending on this game. So the story mode only took me about 5-7 hours but if you want to go past the story mode and complete everything you will be looking at about 100-200 hours worth of gameplay depending of what type of gamer you are. So in conslusion this game is perfect for veteran gamers and rookie gamers alike, along with a ton of replay value makes this game a 10/10 in my eyes.

Amazing, simply amazing. The combat is fluent and enjoyable, and I really enjoy the storyline. Also, I got the Ultimate Edition for $11, like a lot of people, so I get a billion and a half character customizations and some extra missions. Totally worth it, and it plays like a dream when you use a USB controller.

This game broke the mold for fighting games with it's debut: Injustice - Gods Among Us is an adrenaline-fueled fighting game that is everything you'd expect from veteran game designers NetherRealm Studios.  They powerfully brought the DC Universe to life with a huge roster of Super Heroes and Super Villains to choose from, as well as a wide selection of stages to battle on - including specific parts of said stages.   Thought the fighting genre was getting stale?  Couldn't agree more - that's why NetherRealm brought new innovation to the table.  Now you can interact with your environments!  Fully destructable and fully interactive stages to battle on. Swing from a chandelier to drop down on your opponent, grab a motorcycle to run them over with, throw them through walls to cause environmental damage and to send them soaring to another part of the stage. This game has it all.  Each character is usually assigned to a specific style of gameplay - some are gadget users and some use sheer strength. Each has their own unique abilities as well as their own special move that does huge damage to your opponent.  This game is the epitome of superhero fighting games.  10/10

Really good fighting game for PC! if your looking for a competitive easy to pick up and play fighter for the PC, then this is the game for you. There's no real need to know anything about the characters just so long as you know there names and my knowledge of DC is pretty thin, but that didn't stop me from enjoying this game as I was mostly interested because of Batman as he's the only DC character I know well.  But this game truly makes you like all the characters each character has a different unique fighting style and powers, which make each fight different I found myself liking other characters apart from Bats although he's my favourite character to play normally, I grew to like Green Arrow, The Flash, and surprisingly Aquaman. But the most interesting character in this game is Superman we get to see him at his worst and at his best, this game shows how evil Superman can be and it's quite scary because of the things he does he clearly shows that he's not afraid to kill anyone.  The way the game does this is that there are alternate universers so the evil Supes is the result of what happened when The Joker destroyed Metropolis and tricked Superman into thining he himself did it, and so drives him down a dark path meanwhile the Batman from their universe brings over the original Good heroes from the other dimension and they team up to try and bring evil Supes down. It's a pretty good story and the cutscenes are enjoyable to watch with great visuals and even better voice acting it's hands down the best Super Hero fighter i've played.  I highly reccommend you get this game if you enjoy fighing games like Mortal Kombat which this game can be compared to but I prefer this over it, so whenever you get a chance grab it I guarantee you will have fun.

This game Is One of the best fighting games around. Many people complain about the port and the graphics but mine runs perfectly 10/10 and the reason that the online sometimes SOMETIMES dosent work is because nobody plays but the singleplayer is stelllar.

Great DC Approach on a fighting game. No need to unlock characters. Story Battle. Story mode. UI ranked 7/10.  Theyre had been lagging issues but I'm not having any. Game is running 50-61 FPS on my laptop.
This game is freaking AWESOME!!!!!! I like it better than Mortal Kombat
Good game, 100x better when you have a couple of controllers and few friends over! Would definitely recommend.

When it comes to fighting games I have played them all. Injustice is pretty, fun and smooth to play. It is not as refined as Street Fighter but fighting with DC Titans makes up for that. The controller support for this game is not the best. It has been improved by a few patches but still just doesn't feel tight and right.   It is a decent fighter and well worth a sale price.

PROS:  + awesome story + many different battle modes + lots of unlockables + leveling system + cool soundtrack   CONS:  - poor balance between characters - occasional frame dip - Online Multiplayer has a small amount of people   Comment:  First thing that came to my mind was Casual Mortal Kombat. But I played further the game showed me that it is not just a clone of MK with DC characters. Actually, the game has similar patterns but branches out to something different. The story feels good and sits well with the Injustice story line of DC Comics. With the various battle modes available it gives for many hours of gaming. The combos and gameplay of most characters feel unique and interesting. However, this comes at a price to balance because some characters are simply better than others when it comes to fighting. Some other negatives are an occassonal frame dip caused by game coding. Online Multiplayer is not what it used to be when it comes to the amount of players so make sure to have some friends to play this with. But all that aside I went and rated this from Good to Very Good because it's DC ... because I am a big fan of comics. There is nothing like punching Superman with Batman ... or destroying Doomsday with Harley Quinn. This game is FUN and has a cool soundtrack, recommended!

A Super Hero fighting games in the vein and from the creators of Mortal Combat 9. The game is less violent in the sense of blood, bones and other internal organs, but those super heros are ain't no girl-scouts. Although the online MP is practically dead - it's almost impossible to find a match especially as a beginner (there are a few sharks lurking on the servers) ,so don't expect to do those acheivements, the local MP is fun (with all those special powers and super-moves), and there are also 1. The story mode (gets you to know most heroes and villians) 2.The various ladders 3. The Star Labs missions - all of these pack hundreds of hours of fun ( I played mostly on offline mode), especially if you're after those pesky achievments.  Since you can get this game pretty cheap these days, if you like fighting games for the SP and local MP I find it highly recommendable. Nothing astonishing, but still fun and good value for money. 8/10.

Bought this game as a distractuion from Dota 2 and wow 3 Hours in and loving Single Player.  All your favourite super heros in a nice campaign whats not to like !  GHavent tried Multiplayer yet but i got high hopes

Injustice is a great 2d fighter game. I've played it locally and online with friends.   Gameplay- Injustice has great gameplay. You can pull off combos and use special moves. You can also interact with the map to hurt the other players. You can block, jump, hit, and more. Rating: 9/10  Graphics- It is 2d, but the game looks amazing. There is detail in the background and characters. Rating: 8/10  Online- The game has online but good luck finding a match. Currently, the online is empty and you should try to find people to play with. Rating: 4/10(no one plays online)  Price-  The game costs $20 as of 1/27/2016. It comes with all the dlc(yes including scorpion). I bought it when it was on sale for $5 and haven't regretted it since. The game goes on sale often so I would definitely pick it up when it's on sale. Rating: 7/10  Controls- You can use a keyboard or a controller. You can use the keyboard to play it as well as a controller. It is very easy to map the buttons. Rating: 9/10  Story Mode- The story mode was kind of short but I think the story itself is good. You play as many characters in the story and if you play the mobile too, you can get Prison Superman on the mobile edition by completing the story mode on PC or any other console. Rating: 8/10  Overall Rating: 8/10
Very good game, nice graphics and sound effects. Nothing bad to say about it. Is a must have if you enjoy this gender! 8/10

Injustice is a game created by NetherRealm Studios (FYI the creators of the highly proclaimed Mortal Kombat) So you would think this is a good fighting right ? And you're right, at it's core this is a magnificent game(A good roster,perfectly balanced)   Now let's talk about the singleplayer: In the singleplayer the members of the justice league get teleported to an alternate dimension where superman went rogue and runs a dictatorship, you progress through the story by doing 1v1's with all the characters and doing some minigames along the way. Aside from the story you get the classic modes that yoou can expect in a fighting game(training, arcade battles,local 1v1's)  And now the multiplayer: DON'T BUY THIS GAME This is a fighting game, so you are going to want to show of your skills with your favorite character, right ? HOWEVER NetherRealm doesn't give A ♥♥♥♥ about this PC-port (yes i have the 360 version) the game just doesn't work. You can find people but you can't actually connect to their games. Now i managed to host a lobby with my friends but after a couple matches the game just glitches and everyone leaves the lobby.(And this didn't happen once)  CONCLUSION: Don't buy this game. If the multiplayer worked then this would be a whole different game. But seeing how the modes what you are going to be playing most don't work this game isn't worth the money. Comparing this to the 360 version this is just an all-out SCAM !

This is the best fighter I have played in a long time, the Mortal Kombat team outdid themselves, because this is a game with deep complexity in it's combat system. The DC characters have been fully fleshed out each one feels unique and challenging to master. I have hardly even scratched the surface after completing the solid story mode and trying some of the arcade style battles and I know there is so much more to do. I havent been this psyched for a fighting game since Soul Calibur 2. This version includes all the dlc for the game.

I Don't Do Alot Of Reviewing... With That Being Said This Game Rocks! Great Story Mode Single Player Graphics Are Very Good As Well. Riviting Story Mode Will Keep You Playing Even If You Think You've Had Enough. One Of My Favorites!

all in all a decent game.. the combat is just like every other dam fighting game where you mash buttons in an attempt to make combos and chains. however the enviroment is used a lot more than just smacking people or throwing. you can evade and move based on whats available in the arena your in you fight straight or kite and damage from a distance. the story is a bit cheesy with one liner battles but the game is smooth... hard a hell on a keyboard but fine if you have a controller handy

This game hates keyboard/mouse users. The combat at least against AI is quite slow and clunky. Things don't flow together flluently at all. They tried to make a keyboard mimic a 6 button arcade panel which is painfully unnatural.   Even the most basic combo's often involve keys far out of the way all having to be pushed simultaneously or quickly in order while moving and reacting to your enemy.  It's fairly pretty, but it's also a simple 2d fighting game with minor map interactions and senseless background destruction that doesn't really have much to do with what's happening during the fight. I really don't see how it got such high ratings on Steam, but I imagine with a controller it might be more tolerable.  I never thought i'd recall Dragonball Xenogears fondly, but DBX had fluent and varied open map combat that worked with either control method and a reasonable storyline. This pile does none of that.

It's late to review the game as of now as it was released on November 13, 2013 - quite some time ago.  Anyway, the game is 'awesome' in one word ! I am big fan of Tekken and Mortal Combat franchises and I love these games very much. But this game has taken the hand to hand combat genre to a different level. Since, the game is entirely based on the DC universe - it will appeal to people who love DC comics (any comics lovers, for that matter) as well as people like me who plays and enjoys hand to hand combat games.  So, let me just carry on with the review in detailed segments.  1) Story:  This game has a variety of single player options. One of them is the 'Story mode'. As it is described in the game, Superman from another parallel dimension looses control of his emotion - as the Joker tricked him to kill Louis and their unborn child along with the destruction of the entire Metropolis. After that he 'crosses the line' and kills joker. This alters his personality and thus forms a 'Earth 1 Govt.' and ushers his reign. Some of his fellow league members joins him as a ruler and most of the rest of the heroes who stood against him dies. The remaining heroes, who are not with this 'evil' superman forms the resistance, led by none other than Batman. The story starts as this resistance leader asks for for help from the heroes of our world by snatching them from our dimension. What happens next ??... play the game !  2) Graphics :  This the next thing that you would feel - is awesome! The effects are stunning and the scripts are seamlessly integrated to the context of the screen. The model details are very very accurate. Since I am using a stone age 9500 GT my system could only manage a bearable FPS only at 640x480 (ridiculous, I know) I can't elaborate the graphics too much here ; but if I crank up the settings (and sacrifice the FPS) just to get the feel of the graphics - they really looked great on my 22' HD monitor.  3) Gameplay:  The game play is a bit difficult in the keyboard as it ported straight out of the console platform to PC. But anyway - its not Call of Duty either and most of the hand to hand combat games are created keeping consoles in mind. But after you get used to the controls a bit you will find that its a hell of an enjoyment in playing the game. The ghosting effects are pretty less once you get the feel of your system's I/O lags- still its easy to carry on combos or streaks of attacks.  The environment is engaging and interactive to a large extent (considering the genre)- things that you can pick up and throw at your opponents. the maps(levels) may have multiple sections where you can hit the wall along with your opponent and smash it to transit to next area. And this entire functions can generate combo hits.  Overall the game is a 'go' from my side , hope that it will do justice to you as well.  - Justice -

Probably the most casual 2D fighter of this generation. Pretty fun if you don't actually try to play it too seriously. NRS thought it would be a good idea to count half of quarter-circle-motions as a full quarter-circle, so if you try to do a crouching 1 and input d, db, 1 (as you would in every other fighting game ever) the game will execute d, db, b, 1 (which, most likely, causes a special move to come out). Also the input-window for buttons being so large can really mess you up on quick inputs, especially so if you use negative edge- it's a nightmare.  Online is very poor- if you get less than 60 FPS, you won't be able to find any lobbies or be able to connect to anyone until you fix it (for most people who post about the game not working online, this seems to be the issue). In itself, that's great and necessary, but the game doesn't actually tell you this  anywhere . It's a sort of natural selection for online-play. Once you have overcome that hurdle (which, to be fair, won't be a hurdle to anyone with a decent PC), you might still randomly crash at character-selection, stage-selection or after fully loading into the game. Once you have gotten past that, you may finally be in a game only to find that your controls have reset to either the default setting, or your opponent's set-up. This can be fixed by going into the settings and out again  every time  you launch the game. The actual netcode seems alright if you have a good connection to your opponent, but once there is the slightest amount of lag, it becomes unplayable. I guess GGPO was too cheap and efficient for them. As a small tip for audio-issues, if your sound is muffled, try using stereo-sound in your OS, they somehow managed to even screw up speaker-selection. If you want to make a private lobby with friends, you need to invite them through Steam directly, pressing 'invite friends' in-game will make the game crash to desktop, just fyi.  Injustice has invisible hitboxes (Mahvel and MK style), auto-correct for directional inputs that works whenever it feels like it (as in: it will not only auto-correct specials, but if you jump-in cross-up, it will mirror your inputs mid-combo!) and no logical approach to frame-data whatsoever. Never have I played a game that was so inconsistent with which moves are safe and which aren't- I'm fairly sure they randomized all of that (at least that's the only explanation/excuse for slow overhead swings with 0 recovery and punishable jabs). The execution-ceiling is very low, which can be great in a game with good footsies and basics, which Injustice doesn't have. The story-mode doesn't allow you to choose a character, but it follows a fixed story-line which forces random characters upon you all the time.  On to the good things: Training mode is very customizeable (moreso than most games of this gen), you can look up all frame-data for characters on their ingame-movelist, the singleplayer is fleshed out a lot more than in most fighters (lots of Tekken-esque mini-games and modes), you can enable/disable negative edge in the settings and the visuals are pretty okay.  Buy it for a tenner or less if you like casual fighting-games. I can also recommend this game if you regularily get mad at stupid crap in other fighters- playing this trash will give you some perspective.

If you, like me, have Windows 8, DO NOT buy this. It's horribly optimized and doesn't always even run. Sometimes, you have to restart Steam in order for it to work, which is ridiculous.  I managed to play about an hour of this until I got sick of how the game ran, it's crashes, it's compatibility issues, and horrible optimization.  In that hour, I must admit that the game was fun. It has plenty of characters that are all very interesting and familiar if you're a big fan of DC Comics. The environmnets are interesting, interactive, and dynamic to certain extents, which makes combat even more fun. I managed to play through Batman's chapter in the Story mode, which was entertaining and good. The story seemed interesting enough to play through, yet nothing amazing or far too great.  The fighting is cool and good since all characters have their own finishes, moves, and combat styles. It's well balanced between the characters and it feels like as if this could have been a competetive fighter even.  In the end, I recommend this to those of you who have Windows 7. To those of you who have Windows 8, or lower, DO NOT BUY. Actually, even if you do have Windows 7, I highly recommend you think about purchasing this. I'm glad I got this on a sale...

However this review wont be about the gameplay or history, but about the port. Since long every pc player encounters a port so porly made that it's imposible to play the game, sadly injustice gods among us is not the exeption High Voltage Software did his absolute worst job, creating a port so bad that the multiplayer (The key feature for any fighting game) IS BARELY PLAYABLE. and im just being nice, in 15 hours of gameplay i finished the story mode in 3 - 4 hours and play training or arcade for 6 - 7 hours. The other 3 Hours you ask? well i'd be kind to say that 1 hour was me playing online with my friends or random players, i think its about 30 minutes and the rest ♥♥♥♥ING SERCHING FOR A GAME, TRYING TO MAKE THE MULTIPLAYER WORK OR ENTERING A GAME TO ONLY GET A ♥♥♥♥ING MESSAGE SAYING 'Session no longer available' over and over again. if you ask me injustice is an incredible fighting game but in this horrible state and no care about the game with no patches over a year or more with the same problem since day one, this make a list of games that is qualified as 'BUY IF YOU WANT A GOOD GAME THAT CANNOT BE PLAYED'. so dont buy this is not worth a penny in this state and thanks to High Voltage it never will. I'm not a big fan of fighting games. I was of the original Mortal Kombat games but lost interest in the series, and fighting games overall not far after Ultimate MK3. I've enjoyed the occasional fighting games since like a random Soul Calibur game or maybe a few rounds of Tekken with friends, but never enough to go out and buy it. When the Mortal Kombat remake came out I bought it for the console and fell in love. After hearing Injustice was made by the same people I had to buy it being a huge fan of the DC universe. The main story is exciting and a lot of fun to play. It is short... but it is a fighting game so you can't fault it for that. If your having frame skip like then try this. It may not work for all Go to nvidia control panel > 3D settings > Manage 3D settings > Program Settings > under select a program to to customize chose Injustice: Gods Among Us (injustice.exe) and then click Add > scroll down and find Vertical sync and turn it Off.  After doing this my game ran smooth at 60fps Hope this helps

Visually impressive [✓] Well written story [✓] Wide variety of characters and environments [✓] Explosions [✓]  Okay, so its a free to play weekend on Injustice and I've just played through the full storymode in one sitting - it's not often I can find a game that holds my attention for so long at a time; my clock time is over 6hrs from just the one session, though admittedly that includes the pause menu for maybe an hour or so for meals and breaks etc.  The vast majority of the storymode is watching cutscene cinematics so don't expect none-stop button bashing if that's what you're after but if like me, you enjoy the 'interactive movie' style Injustice offers up, I'd very much recommend this to you.  My only advice if you get the PC version would be this: buy a game pad first. (though given genre of the game, most of you reading this will have concluded that yourselves already.)  Conclusion: It's a superhero game that doesn't suck a**. Thumbs up!

Holy ♥♥♥♥, this is one hell of a fighter. Lets get the breakdown started.  Story:  This game is a fighter and has an awesome story. I know, that is rare in a fighter, but this game sort of took the flashpoint paredox story and changed big time. They keep the parellel demention and fighting between heroes, but they make it superman based and not flash. So here is the backstory though. Superman, in a paralel demention, is tricked by Joker into killing Lois and their unborn baby. So he kills joker. Then destroys metropolis city, and takes over the world. Then batman brings over our dementions batman and other justice league members to stop him. Story 9/10  Gameplay:  This game features a typical fighter game gameplay. You have a pretty cool combo system, a cool set of characters, etc. Then one of the things that I like most is the interative enviroment. Most fighters don't have that. So i really enjoyed this. Now I don't be like me and use your keyboard. It is not easy. I recommend using an Arcade Stick, but if you don't have one use an XBOX controller. Gameplay gets a 10/10  Graphics:  The graphics in this game are pretty good. Nothing amazing, but not bad. Graphics get a 7/10  Cons:  Some crashes and glitches Short Story  And Lex Luthor is ridiculously powerful.   All in All injustice is a great fighter. my final verdict is 9/10.

This is an excellent game. I recommend to anyone who likes a 2D fighting game. If you like Mortal Kombat 9 or X, then this is the game for you. There are plenty of characters to choose from. The mechanics are almost the exact same thing as MK9 and X. Only downside I could think is that each character only has 1 super move so watching the same super gets old after a while. Also, cutscenes are locked at 30 fps. Why would you lock something at such a low framerate? Personally, I like seeing 60 fps because it looks a lot more realistic and fluid. I could understand that some people lock their cutscenes at 30 fps because most films are filmed at 29, but this isn't a film people. This is a video game.  So overall, I would give this game a 8 out of 10. The gameplay is great. The story is pretty good. There is even some humor in it.

I'm not experienced with fighting games. Not too good at them either, as this game forcefully taught me over and over again.  The good: -Interesting story, featuring a multitude characters, each with unique and relevant moves -Decent range of maps, most with dynamic backgrounds and changing areas -No one is too under- or over-powered, so Catwoman can beat Doomsday without any problems  The bad: -A lot of the special moves need overly specific conditions, so you're lucky if you even see that double jump reversal block thing the tutorial wouldn't let you move on from practicing until you did it 3 times in a row -The special cinematic move each character gets gets boring after a few times, only so many times I can watch Superman punch the Joker into outer space and back with the same enthrallment as the first time, especially when he just gets up right after and throws some fake teeth at me -It gets difficult enough that time has to be spent practicing with the current character and learning their moves, only to have the next 10 fights as other people, and by the time you get back to the character, you've forgotten everything  But who am I kidding, I should have just button mashed my way through it, and just bought a new keyboard after.

Don't get me wrong, I absolutely LOVE this game! The story is amazing, and the little easter eggs that are throughout the campaign and stages are rather pleasing to the DC comics fan such as myself.   However, the online multiplayer is completely broken... None of the servers work, and nobody is ever online becuase of that. I bought this game to play with other people online - to show off my Injustice skills (which, although are lacking, are pretty good) , but I am unable to do so because the online is broken.  On the contrary, the graphics are amazing, the gameplay is really fun, and the characters are from all corners of the DC universe. I would recommend this game to people who buy fighting games for the story; an audience that is severly lacking...

A clear-cut and not-at-all-surprising 8 / 10  Pros:  - Amazing cast of characters! Only a few are missing from this roster, but you won't really care. All characters are unlocked from the start! Some really great skins are added here, although some characters have far fewer additional skins than others. A few, like Regime Sinestro, are kinda ridiculous, but that's ok. Effort was put into making the characters different depending on their skins as well. This was an extremely deserved an well-executed touch. Most of these effects are shown in Clashes when characters speak. Also, they speak to each other! That rocks! - Solid, fast-paced fighting mechanics makes this game as much of a thrill to watch as to play. Combos need to be practiced to be made perfect, no question. More on Practice mode later. The fast gameplay can be daunting for new players, but the game is fantastic at ranging difficulty and training in Practice mode, so don't be SCURRED :) You will be fine with enough time and energy. - Use of envirornment will give advantage, but these option can be toggled if you don't want that. Use of enviornmentals is versatile and varies between the different character types, thus making stage selection very important! There is quite a large variety for what is used and how they are used. In terms of enviornments alone, Injustice surpasses practically any other fighter out there, including games from Netherrealm Studios. - Graphics, sounds, and voices all spot on (Raven's voice is a little off, though). Easily some of the best background graphics in any fighter. I really, really want to emphasize the graphics and sounds; these are one of the best highlights of the game, no question. Each sound effect feels real and the movements and expressions of the models are eerily lifelike.  - Characters are well balanced, pandering to all types of players and their preferences, although there are not enough gadeget characters like Batman, Nightwing, and Green Arrow. Would be nice to have more of these (Arsenal, Red Robin, Red Hood, Ravager, etc.)  - Practice mode is extensive (with players able to record playbacks of combos) and statistics for every single move, such as frame counts and damage, are all noted and easy to find. Also, these moves can be pinned onto the game screen for players new to the character they are using (noobs and pros alike!). Definitely one of the highlights - Story is interesting and hard to stop playing. I have played it at least 10 times and I still love it. - Some 300 mini extra side missions (S.T.A.R Labs) to play through (some are very difficult!!!). - Online mode works well with a decent frame rate, despite very, VERY small population. I never froze up. Multiple game modes in multiplayer (King of the Hill, Survivor, Private/Ranked Rooms, 1v1), but TAG TEAM IS MISSING! THIS IS A HUUUUUUUUUGE LET DOWN!!!! - Battles mode is full of ladders that range from doable to impossible. Character endings are unlocked here.  Cons:  - As aforementioned, NO TAG TEAM!!! WHYYY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!?????????!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!?????? They even teased it!!! :(((( - Controls on the keyboard will take either a ton of getting used to or (like me) a lot of editing. - Characters are plentiful, but Stages are sorely lacking. Most players just pick a select few they like and stick with them the whole way. A couple are even clones of each other! Where is Titans' Tower? Where is Star City? Some iconic locations are really missed among fans like myself. - Character intros, outros, and Super moves NEVER CHANGE! This gets annoying, even though the Supers are still cool. - One thing wrong with fighting mechanics: once your opponent starts juggling, not much you can do if you can't Clash to break the combo. This is a glaring issue only if they have mastered combos that take, like, 91% of your health, so be wary of your opponents. - Multiplayer: TOO MANY SPAMMERS OF DEATHSTROKE AND JOKER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Uncool, guys. - Lacking motivation and reward for S.T.A.R. Labs missions, especially with this Ultimate Edition where pretty much everything is unlocked. - Game is taxing on your CPU. You need a really high-end processor for this game, unfortunately. Not like Batman: Arkham Knight, but still a pretty good one is needed. - Despite awesome Practice Mode, Tutorial mode is really lacking and barebones. It doesn't thoroughly teach you all of the ins and outs of the gameplay, so you just have to find them for yourself. - Story mode takes only about 4 to 5 hours the first time around, and that's being generous. Most can finish it in a little over 3. Also, mini games are crammed into the story (mostly QTEs, although Green Arrow's was good) that really just detract from the story's gameplay experience even though they give a health advantage or disadvantage to the player depending on how they do.  Despite all these shortcomings, the game is just so fun it will more than make up for these complaints that seem more like nitpicks rather than game-changing flaws. This is a title you can keep coming back to, whether alone or with a friend, and will have many an hour pounding Joker's laughing butt or Luthor's bald head through buildings and into the ground. The level of detail this game has gives a practically flawless aesthetic feel while playing, and with the sounds, graphics, and fast-paced action of the core gameplay, you won't care about any S.T.A.R. Labs stuff or the Tutorial. For fans, there are enough character related details, skins, and lines that will keep you satisfied.  In all honesty, I have to recommend this game not because it's a great DC game, or a great fighting game in the NRS lineup, but because it's just a great game overall. I think I was a bit too specific in the cons section, because you really won't notice some of them for quite a while. Well, when you play the game for a 100+ hours, that's what happens. :)  Peace everyone, and enjoy! Thanks for reading! :))) :)))  -LC

Loads of fun -- this game can be picked up and played in short 10-minute bursts, or in hours-long marathons. Gorgeous graphics, terrific voice acting, and a compelling storyline to play through. This is the Mortal-Kombat-style game that elevates the genre -- and the closest thing to a Justice League movie this side of the cartoons. Can be coupled with a companion free-to-play app on the tablets and phones, and interlocking acheivements that unlock content in both as you play. A gamepad is a must however, as the mouse is useless and keyboard layout very odd and inconsistent. Best enjoyed on a really fast system, lots of RAM and CPU and GPU horsepower, and if possible, on a Big Screen display (but not necessarily). You see this one sale, buy it and enjoy... great replay value, and lots of mindless fun.

Well, i was hesitant to get this game since its quite expensive. Saw it on a special and got it, still wasnt so sure until i played it.  Its quite a solid fighting game, probably not as solid as ssf, but still it has his merits.  Graphically, the cinematics are great.  While the style of the fighting is not as 'realistic' as in other fighting games, once you play a while, you will familiarize with the style, its quite neat. Also this is the first fighting game that i see that has interaction with the enviroment. I saw this on the presentation of the game, thought it was nice, but once i played, it really adds a lot of variables to the game. Those things can get you back to the fight if you are losing.  The campaign i though it would be different, i was thinking more of picking a hero to play the campaign and then have a point of view of each, but it isnt. You are told a global history and you take control of different characters as you advance with that history.. The campaign is around 60 fights, probably some 5-6 hours, but this is a fighting game, you can do 1v1 with a friend or online, so you can get a lot of hours of gameplay here.  The story of the campaign is great, although not all of the playable characters appear on the campaign, i think they could have somehow add them, but still, great.  Also you have some extra features that you dont have in other games. You have a leveling system (which i dont know why or how to use it, but im sure is useful). You can see the bio of the heroes/villians, unlock some avatars, icons (prob for multiplayer which i havent tested since i dont have the best internet connection).  The voice acting is great, though im not a real fan of dc, i barely know some of the characters, i dont know if they are the original voices of their respective shows, the acting was great, very beliebable and there was not a single annoying voice (like the ones in cartoons).   The soundtrack was also very well done.   All in all i think this is a must for any fighting lover game, it is dark, it is different. 7.5 for me.  Its a bit pricy, i dont know if its worth the 40-50 bucks, specially if you are only playing the campaign and occassionally, but probably about 20-25 sounds allright for the work these good programmers and graphic artist did.

Characters super specials moves are GREAT: they ar very brutal and most of them looks amazing (better than MK X-rays!).  I really, really recommend you playing this game.

Injustice is probably one of the most addictive DC Universe Fighting Game there is. Similer to Super Smash Bros. Injustice features a variety of DC Universe Characters like Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman, Lex Luther, The Joker and my favorite character, Deathstroke. However you need a beefy computer to play this game. My current computer is extremely slow, making the entire battle run in what appears to be 'a very annoying, laggy, jumpy slo-mo battle' this upset me greatly. As I am writing this I may have found a way to at least reduce the lag, as I have seen apperent change in lag with the change of my laptop's graphic resolution/settings on Batman Arkham City. However if you do have a beefy computer and like the DC Universe, even if it is only one character, this game his highly recommended. Gameplay mechanics aren't that great with a keyboard but once you get used to them gameplay quality increases. Character design I have to admit is not so great for Wonder Woman. She doesn't really look all that much like a woman. Her face seems to look 'more manlike' I also didn't like the lack of skins for the dlc characters like Batgirl and the character Nightwing. Being a big Batman fan and knowing a lot about the diffrent costumes it was very upsetting to see these characters not have many skins. The story for this game is absolutely amazing. It sort of reminds me of an episode of Batman: The Brave and the Bold where the Injustice League is evil and the villians (with some changes of appearence and character) are good in that dimension. However this is much more dark then that Batman cartoon since it was based on the 'Silver Age' Batman where everything was campy. It also reminds me of the alternate dimension or timeline in DC Universe Online in some aspects. Since my computer wasn't really qualified to play this game I decided to watch walkthroughs on the game on Youtube and took a look at the online multiplayer. It seems simple. Just beat the other person. It looked pretty fun but as I am writing this my internet keeps disconnecting and reconnecting every few minutes. The selection of characters could have a more variety of characters. I would like to see some of the characters you see in the background of the stages become playable characters like Parasite, Gorrila Grodd, Metallo, Scarecrow and maybe even the Atom and Black Canary. This game came out a while ago however and I see the chance for another DLC to come out is slim. Combat in the game isn't really all that smooth. It's very similer to SSB in this style. I like it when combat in games sort of 'flow and have a rythem' making combat a lot more visually appealling. The stages in the game are pretty streight forward. I would have like there to be more stages and a lot more enviromental changes as combat changes/affects the stage. Glitches are not common. However I have seen glitches in the special moves where you should become invincible or actually hit someone. However sometimes it doesn't happen when it should. Overall I give this game a 6/10 and reccomend it to anyone who is into fightning games or anyone who like the DC Universe.

It is fun to play. The gameplay is nice, the interaction with the surroundings is pretty cool. The story mode is also quite good but a bit short, I think.  You will have fun playing the game even if you don't know all the DC heroes. I only knew Batman and Superman (and a bit of Catwoman/The Flash) when playing this game and had lots fun.  If you are an experienced player or have a whole day time, then you will play through the story mode in a single day.
Have you ever wanted to be Batman, punch Batman, shoot Batman or any other DC superhero?  No? What's wrong with you.  Yes?  Buy the damn game.

So, this game has all the characters and skins already unlocked as it is the ULTIMATE EDITION. However, i will have you know that the pc port is kinda bad, for starters, you cant navigate the menu with a mouse but have to use the keyboard, which tells you already what problems are at stake. The default control scheme also made little sense to me so definetly go over and switch that up first.  The graphics are great for a fighting game and the controls are fine. You can make do with a keyboard but honestly i'd recommend a gaming controller, which this game should probably support for MAXIMUM ENJOYMENT of this game. All in all, if your PC can run this and you're into fighting games and or superheroes and comics this is definetly something you should consider. The campaign is kinda short with a pretty intriguing story so thats not bad, i spent around 4hrs to complete the story. Besides that, there are tons of features still available such as ladder matches and some special missions called STAR MISSIONS with great variety. IE you can control catwoman's cat in a burglary/stealth mission which is pretty good. So you should definetly check this out, if you can i would totally guarantee a controller over a keyboard as that would help maximize your experience.   This game also has VERY good diversity among characters who have indentifiable skills, moves, and abilities. Locations and stages are very iconic and the interaction with your environment helps to immerse you more. For those who like combo fighitng games like myself will not be dissapointed, the learning curve is a bit steep if you've never played fighting games before but its not overly complex or anything but just right, every character has unique move lists, and training modes are also readily available for those who wish to polish their skills. With that, i give this game a 8.6/10 with the content being incredibly vast for a fighting game, definetly check this game out

I restarted the game. I closed all other applications. I disconnected from the internet. I restarted my MSI GE60. I started the game with Nvidia game booster. I lowered the settings to practically NES graphics so the text was unreadable. This is a terrible port.   If you like games in slow motion, maybe you'll enjoy this, but when it takes 5 minutes to get through 90 second fight (probably closer to half that since I've never ran out of time), it's ridiculous. The game is swimmy for 90% of it, then suddenly a fight will be lightning fast. I can't tell if I'm just used to the slow-mo or if the fights are actually sped up, but the Xbox version was nowhere near this awful. It seems like some fights start out fine too, then get boosts in speed or slow downs, usually dependent on if something is happening in the background. Some stages with a lot of commotion and RB stage attacks are just impossible and doing the super move makes it even worse. The fighting is superficial combos and button mashing, but the game could be fun, if it weren't the awful port. I'm running Titanfall on low settings, so I should be able to handle this on at least moderate, but it's not optimized.   The story had potential but it's too black-and-white. It's gritty and edgy themed, but it has the morality meant for children. Here are the heroes, here are the villains. They're working together! But these are still the bad guys and these are still the good guys. There's no gray area and the characters don't bring it to life. Green Arrow tries to be funny, but no one has personality that stands out except The Joker and Harley Quinn, which they're hit and miss. Everyone else is this lifeless shell of their character. The writers seem to think since you know who these characters are, they don't need personalities, but Green Arrow, Green Lantern, Wonder Woman, Aquaman pretty much are interchangeable. Cyborg brings a bit of life to it, but it's his VA and not his actual character traits that stand out.   Maybe if your PC can run it, it'd be a better buy. I'm just glad I got it on sale so I only wasted a little bit of money.

I imagine it will seem somewhat simplistic for hardcore fighting fans, but everything was solid and accessible. After the main story (6ish hours) there's a ton to do if you love the fighting, but I found myself happy to move on.
Can't speak for the multiplayer as Neatherrealm has yet to put out a game with good net code but I reasonably enjoyed story mode and the achievement hunting I did. Grab it for cheap.

It was very epic, and most fights come across as having real power behind the fighters. The scenery gets destroyed not just from you grabbing cars and throwing them at people, but from the backgrounds getting demolished as you perform powerful moves. One character puts an explosive pie between your feet. Another literally punches you through planet earth...twice. It means performing a special move as the first character feels a bit...underwhelming.

As someone who enjoys good fighters and gets really deep into frame data etc. this game is the perfect game to jump into the fighting genre or for everyone who enjoys the DC Universe as much as I do. Before this game was ported to the PC I actively played on the PS3 version of the game climbed the ranking ladder even on the 7th place, after playing around 5 hours a day, for about 4 months and it still didn't get boring. It may not be as challenging as a Street Fighter or a Mortal Kombat, but there are plenty of combo strings to master, many characters with very diverse playstyles and many things to do outside of just fighting online. There are two downsides to this game particular: The first problem is that the online play on the PC is quite underpopulated. This can result in waiting 5 minutes for a match and then getting downed by someone very good if you are completely new to the game and you just start to experience PvP experience. The second thing is the 'STAR Labs' Missions, which are character specific minigames. even though every character has 10 of those, you will soon recognize that there are missions that are 3 times in this mode, for 3 different characters, just with a reskin.  Other than that I would say this should be an instant buy.

I strongly suggest a controller (keyboard was clunky and I made the switch to controller fast!) and don't be scared to try it if this is not your normal game genre -- you might actually find yourself having a good time.

'And justice for all.' 9/10  For someone who isn't too familiar, or very good at fighting games, 'Injustice: Gods Among Us' was surprisingly easy for me to get the hang of once I battled a few opponents. Most fighting games I play just aren't that interesting to me, and that's mostly due to the fact that memorizing button combinations, and taking the time to find a player that I like isn't a journey that I'm willing to take, majority of the time. And it's that reason, and that reason alone why only a few fighting games such as 'Smash Bros, Power Stone' and few others really stand out to me as being highly memorable.  But with 'Gods Among Us', I found myself landing combination after combination early on, almost as if the control scheme was tailored for button mashers, and unskilled fighters to catch on quickly, and it kept me interested and playing long enough to actually get halfway decent at the game. Now maybe all of that is just some stuff that I made up in my brain, or maybe it's not, but 'Injustice' is one of the few fighting games I have actually enjoyed in recent years.  Another aspect of this game that I enjoyed way more than I thought I would, was the story. Most new age fighting games create some strangely flowing plot that barely makes sense to explain all of the fighting, and this game is no different, but it worked nonetheless. There's just something about an evil 'Superman' that really gets my blood boiling. If you're like me, and have a difficulty getting into most fighting games, but would like to, consider picking this one up.

5.1/10 - Urgh. Just... Urgh!  This annoyed me. Plays well, looks good. Decent amount of characters with a host of skins available. Easy controls to master for those who are familiar with the Mortal Kombat series. The story was rubbish, as is the leveling system.  It's not a beat'em'up, well it is, but it doesn't quite feel like it. It just feels a little hollow. It makes me wonder if LEGO had made this how much better it would have been, which is odd but likely true.  Would recommend only for those that are a a fan of DC as you'll get some fan satisfaction, especially with the voice acting if nothing else. Or if your a MK fan as the gameplay with sit nicely with you. For those that love beat'em'ups, nah it's just not quite there.

Bought this title because of the DC license, being a huge fan of comics...  Long story short, it's not very good at all verging closer to straight up awful. The controls are clunky even after manual configuration, the graphics are second rate for even last gen console and the tranistions between areas is plain ugly and jarring.  The game focuses on the Justice League who are taken into another timeline, a great little setup for an alternate story that's not really bogged down by the rules of the new 52 of pre-52 universe. It's a shame that this story line is tied to a Mortal Kombat fighting game which seems to waste the potential it gave itself, instead of focusing on a badass new world ran by a tyrant superhero we get one transition fight scene to another, since this game is a fighting one. It's not super smooth going from one fight to another and comes across forced, unfortunatley this genre game is not built for an intense story that they try to offer.   Whoever redesigned the suits needs to take a step back and let someone else take over, the over armored and over styled outfits look ridiculous, especially Batman who straight up looks like he has a pair of underpants for a cowl, what is that faceplate?   The voice actors are not great, sounding bored through most of the lines given. This is most evident in Hal Jordan who lacks any real charisma or attitude, instead opting for cliche male super type voice.  Overall even on sale this game disapoints, it's potential that's wasted on a game type that doesn't need elaborate storys to succeed. As a standalone animated film this would be enjoyable, as a game it fails utterly. Going from 8 different areas or so and through each character twice is an absolute slog.

This game just barely gets a yes on my recommendation. The actual fighting engine is competent, but the online component has been broken every time I've had to use it. I'd recommend buying this if you want a single player experience, but skip it unless the online matchmaking gets a solid fix.

3/10 This game in my opinion is the biggest let down of 2014 for me as a big DC fan.  -Clunky controlls (Good luck getting your attacks to work like you want them to) -Slow paced fighting (Aside from computer players) -No block button (DC Heros are not smart enough to block)  Review:  If you are expecting a Mortal Kombat style fighting game with DC Heros, Villians and Story then half of your expectations will be met. Yes the charecters are DC Heros and Villans with Scorpian because why not and the plot is rather nice infact I love the story.   However I find the controlls to clunky and slow which makes enjoying playing as my favorite DC Heros impossible, Even the Flash, One of the fastest in the universe is slow as molasses.    You may be thinking well SERUniversal probably just sucks at fighting games. I loved Mortal Kombat 9 and was excellent at the combat (Although I hated the trashy ♥♥♥♥ story) and it was fast paced and smooth even though there were points in time I would get demolished and would rage out.    I would highly recomend not spending anymore then $5.00 USD on this game.

I enjoyed mostly everything about the game, but let me tell you what I hated about the game: THE ♥♥♥♥ING STAR LABS MISSIONS. I'll admit I did have some fun with them, but trying to complete every mission with 3 stars could take its toll on a young man like myself. I shiver whenever I think about how much misery and anger they have caused me. They reminded me how many times I wanted to staple my nutsack to the ceiling. Nevertheless, it's a very solid fighting game with (most of) your favourite DC Comics characters. Just be aware of the STAR Labs.
